nodes.description: 三辆载有自杀式炸弹的卡车在2002年12月27日冲入格罗兹尼政府总部
nodes.support_text: The Grozny truck bombing occurred on December 27, 2002, when three Chechen suicide bombers ran vehicles into the heavily guarded republic's government headquarters in the regional capital Grozny.

nodes.description: 袭击者身着联邦军服并携带通行证，通过前三道军事检查站
nodes.support_text: The drivers of two vehicles reportedly wore federal military uniforms and carried official passes which allowed them through three successive military checkpoints on their way to the headquarters building.

nodes.description: 第四道检查站岗哨开枪拦截卡车，随后卡车冲入政府大楼引发爆炸
nodes.support_text: A guard at the fourth and final checkpoint attempted to inspect the vehicles, and began firing on the vehicles as they drove through the checkpoint towards the building.

nodes.description: 爆炸使用相当于一吨 dynamite 的炸药，摧毁四层建筑结构
nodes.support_text: The explosion by the equivalent of a ton of dynamite brought down the roof and floors of the four-story building.

nodes.description: 初期报告称最少2人死亡，最终确认83人遇难，210人受伤
nodes.support_text: The first reports said of as few as two dead. Ultimately, Chechen officials said 83 people were killed (48 on the spot) and 210 were injured.

nodes.description: 切钦官员朱娜·巴蒂采娃等多人受伤，地方行政首脑阿赫马德·卡德罗夫未在现场
nodes.support_text: Several Chechen administration officials were injured in the attack, including Deputy Prime Minister Zina Batyzheva (seriously wounded) and Chechen Security Council Secretary Rudnik Dudayev. The head of the pro-Russian administration in Chechnya, Akhmad Kadyrov, and his Prime Minister, Mikhail Babich, were not in the building at the time.

nodes.description: 联邦部队发言人称袭击由阿卜杜勒-瓦利德和沙米尔·巴沙耶夫策划
nodes.support_text: Colonel Ilya Shabalkin, spokesman for the joint federal forces in Chechnya, said the bombing was organized by Chechen rebel field commanders Abu al-Walid and Shamil Basayev.

nodes.description: 巴沙耶夫声称通过遥控装置引爆炸弹并承担全部责任
nodes.support_text: Basayev claimed responsibility for the planning and execution of the attack, saying that he personally detonated the bomb by remote control.
